snippet: Recent excavations have dispelled notions that nomadic societies on the arid Eurasian steppes were less developed than many sedentary ones.
abstract: New archaeological studies have found evidence that the nomadic cultures of Central Asia, which left no written record, were far more advanced than had previously been believed; many newly-found objects attesting to the intricacy of nomadic culture are on view at the Nomads and Networks exhibition at New York University's Institute for the Study of the Ancient World.
lead_paragraph: Recent excavations have dispelled notions that nomadic societies on the arid Eurasian steppes were less developed than many sedentary ones.

headline.seo: From Their Graves, Ancient Nomads Speak
headline.main: Artifacts Show Sophistication of Ancient Nomads
headline.print_headline: A Method to Ancient Nomads’ Movements
